channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Square Enix will show off 'Babylon's Fall' from PlatinumGames during E3
item.description: Square Enix's E3 presentation on June 13th will include a fresh look at Babylon's Fall.

item.title: United Airlines plans to add 15 Boom Supersonic jets to its fleet
item.description: he carrier plans to purchase 15 of Boom's Overture planes once the aircraft meets its "demanding safety, operating and requirements."

item.title: Apple updates AirTags to address stalking concerns
item.description: Apple has updated AirTags in order to address privacy concerns associated with the Bluetooth trackers.

item.title: Ubisoft will reveal whatever 'Rainbow Six Quarantine' is now at E3
item.description: It will have a new name, for obvious reasons.

item.title: Twitter's app is getting a dedicated Spaces section
item.description: In case there was any doubt about Twitter’s commitment to Spaces, the company is giving the Clubhouse-like audio feature its own section of the app.

item.title: ZOIA 2.0 update unlocks more power for complex modular effects
item.description: Empress Effect's do-it-all guitar pedal is now even more powerful and versatile.

item.title: BlackBerry is Reddit's latest meme stock
item.description: The share price has shot up in recent days, while AMC is on another big run.

item.title: The official E3 2021 schedule includes Take-Two, Gearbox and WB Games
item.description: With the start of E3 2021 a little more than a week away, the Electronic Software Association has shared the official schedule for the four-day virtual event.

item.title: Google is bringing more Enhanced Safe Browsing protections to Chrome
item.description: It will add more safeguards against potentially malicious extensions and downloads.

item.title: Toyota’s electric concept SUV lands in the US ahead of its 2022 launch
item.description: Toyota’s bZ4X BEV concept SUV started turning heads when it debuted at Auto Shanghai earlier this year, and its journey to the United States has already begun. The automaker confirmed yesterday that the concept vehicle has officially landed in its Plano, Texas headquarters, and that it plans to begin selling the angular crossover in the US sometime next year. (Here’s hoping it gets less tongue twister-y name when it arrives.)

item.title: The IOC is releasing Olympic pins as NFTs
item.description: Working with the IOC, video game developer nWay will release an officially licensed set of NFT Olympic Pins on June 17th.

item.title: Pixel Buds A-Series review: Impressive features for $99
item.description: Google’s latest true wireless earbuds are a $99 version of the Pixel Buds it debuted in 2020. Surprisingly, the company kept nearly all of the features that made those buds such a good option for users who prefer Google Assistant.

item.title: Introducing Engadget's 2021 Father's Day gift guide
item.description: Here's Engadget's Father's Day gift guide for 2021, full of the best tech gift ideas for dad.

item.title: Facebook will give creators more info on how people use their images
item.description: Facebook is giving creators tools that offer insights into how others use their images — including unauthorized use.

item.title: Nextdoor makes it easier to find free stuff your neighbors are giving away
item.description: You won't need an account to browse the items your neighbors are giving away.

item.title: The best home entertainment gift ideas for dad
item.description: Find the best home entertainment gift ideas for dad, including streaming devices, OLED TVs, headphones and more chosen by Engadget.

item.title: Help your distributed team thrive with a cloud ERP
item.description: Learn how to go beyond remote connection for a more productive workplace.

item.title: Google will make it harder to track Android users across apps (updated)
item.description: Google is adding privacy protections to Android that will make it harder for advertisers to track you across apps.

item.title: American Heart Association says MagSafe could interfere with cardiac devices
item.description: Researchers suggest there’s a risk when Apple's iPhone 12 Pro Max is placed very close to pacemakers.

item.title: What to expect from Apple's online-only WWDC 2021
item.description: Google I/O is done, and so is Microsoft Build — that means Apple’s Worldwide Developers Conference is the last high-profile software showcase for at least a month. If you’re one to take Apple at its word, this year’s WWDC is shaping up to be the “biggest and best yet,” which leads us to the obvious question: what does the company plan to show off this year? Short answer: a lot.

item.title: Peloton discounts digital memberships for students, military and first responders
item.description: Peloton is cutting the price of its digital memberships for students, healthcare workers, teachers, first responders, military and military families.

item.title: Twitter Blue subscriptions launch in Canada and Australia first
item.description: Twitter's new “Twitter Blue” service, which gives users access to “exclusive” features for a few bucks a month, is launching in Canada and Australia.

item.title: Ford brings back the Maverick name for a new compact truck
item.description: Rumors about Ford's Maverick pickup have been floating around for a long time, and next week it will reveal the compact truck to the world.

item.title: WhatsApp is finally figuring out true multi-device support
item.description: WhatsApp has revealed that multi-device support is coming soon, letting you chat across four devices.

item.title: Vizio SmartCast TV owners no longer need two apps for YouTube and YouTube TV
item.description: Looking for YouTube TV on your SmartCast device? Check the main YouTube app, as it's moving there now.
